intro: Calamintha stricta, commonly known as narrowleaf germander, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in whorls and are usually pink or purple, blooming in late summer. Calamintha stricta is often used in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and aromatic properties.
